text: hey <@U02HCCTFL>! do we have all of the hardware for TW here? evans had the idea to take a photo of one of each of the hardware offerings to send out to hackathon registrants. serves the dual purpose of getting people excited for the event and letting them know what types of hardware they can expect to find at the event. would love to do this if possible.
The hardware is listed on the event page
we don't have much here yet
Also, we have created a <http://hackster.io|hackster.io> page which we will be sharing with all registrants on Monday

attachments.title: SmartThings - Hackathon of Things
attachments.text: Discover hacks and projects built during SmartThings - Hackathon of Things!

text: We are trying to get a logo up there as well
This has the prizes listed on it.
So basically, ball is in Mager's court unless we want to customize the page in any way
thingweek sign is basically done. thing is glued up, thing lights up. thing uses pin 8 and 135 neopixels as a note to future Josh
currently using pieces of paper as diffusors but I can run to tapp plastics on monday if people want
lights are currently running the adafruit strandtest program which isn't bad but I/we can modify if people want something different
